result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Louis Marshall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Marvin Louis Marshall.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record regarding crime lab testing results. No objections from the State. Court further vacates 11/14/2022 jury trial date, sets 02/17/2022 deadline for the State to provide crime lab testing results to defense, and orders case adjourned for new jury status hearing and jury trial dates.
Jury status hearing scheduled for March 17, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for March 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Witness List
Received and Filed. STATES SUPPLEMENTAL WITNESS LIST
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-28-22
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST
Received and Filed. STATES REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTION
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE

Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear by video means.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 10/24/2022. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in court, via zoom, with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but need additional time to review with client. Court grants request and sets 07/11/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-23-22

Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in court with Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Service Supervision Report 4-18-22

Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-23-22
22RM014274  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/18/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Marvin Louis Marshall in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marvin Louis Marshall appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
